options.content:
# Capacity Overview by Workload Type & CPU Architecture

This section displays current resource utilization organized by **workload type** (General Purpose, HANA) and **CPU architecture** (Cascade Lake, Sapphire Rapids). The visualizations show available capacity percentages for CPU, RAM, and Disk resources across your infrastructure.

**Note:** All capacity calculations are based on Cortex's knowledge database, which includes potential overcommit scenarios (e.g. vCPU overcommit) and considers all initial placement/scheduling constraints and objectives to provide realistic capacity estimates.

## Current Filters Applied
The displayed data is filtered based on your current selections:
- **Availability Zone**: Controls which zones are included in the analysis
- **Hypervisor Family**: Filters by virtualization platform (KVM, VMware)

## Understanding the Metrics
Each panel shows the percentage of **available capacity** (not utilization) for the selected resource type. Higher percentages indicate more available resources for new workloads.

---

For detailed breakdowns and historical trends, explore the **"Total Over Current Selection"** section below, where you can:
- View aggregated totals across your current filter selection
- Analyze capacity trends over time
- Examine per-host capacity distribution
- Apply additional filters for deeper analysis (specific hypervisors, workload types, CPU architectures)

targets.expr:
count(
  max by (compute_host) (
    cortex_sap_total_allocatable_capacity_per_host{
      # Use any resource here, otherwise the amount would have to be divided by 3, since the metric is exported 3 times per hypervisor (cpu, ram, disk)
      resource="cpu",
      availability_zone=~"$availability_zone",
      compute_host=~"$compute_host",
      hypervisor_family=~"$hypervisor_family",
      workload_type="general-purpose",
      cpu_architecture="cascade-lake",
      enabled="true"
    }
  )
) or on() vector(0)

count(
  max by (compute_host) (
    cortex_sap_total_allocatable_capacity_per_host{
      # Use any resource here, otherwise the amount would have to be divided by 3, since the metric is exported 3 times per hypervisor (cpu, ram, disk)
      resource="cpu",
      availability_zone=~"$availability_zone",
      compute_host=~"$compute_host",
      hypervisor_family=~"$hypervisor_family",
      workload_type="general-purpose",
      cpu_architecture="cascade-lake",
      enabled="false"
    }
  )
) or on() vector(0)

predict_linear(
  sum(
    max by (compute_host, resource) (
      cortex_sap_available_capacity_per_host{
        resource="cpu",
        availability_zone=~"$availability_zone",
        compute_host=~"$compute_host",
        hypervisor_family=~"$hypervisor_family",
        workload_type="general-purpose",
        cpu_architecture="cascade-lake",
        enabled="true"
      }
    )
  )
[56d:], 4838400) 
/ 
sum(

list.description: You can enter a project_id here, to see the capacity that is available for this project. This includes hosts that are reserved for this project, but also all the capacity that is not reserved for any project. Example "my-project-id|my-other-project-id".
list.name: project_id
